result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan C Conner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: imposed/stayed - Defendant refused probation so sentence is imposed 5/15/14

miscConds.notes: $300.00 paid directly to COC from bail money
No contact with Jessica Beecroft unless probation and Jessica agree to contact.

Comply with any and all treatment that DOC may recommend and follow thru with all recommendations made.  Psychological assessment/evaluation and any follow thru.  To obtain and maintain employment.  Any Conditions DOC may impose.  to submit a DNA Sample.

Defendant Bryan C Conner in court, in custody via phone.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3:52 PM Court calls cases and recites appearances.  Court addressed Mr. Conner - defendant is requesting to return to probation.  Court makes stmt.  Defendant states he didn't remember signing the post-conviction relief forms.  Court continues to address the defendant re: to take the imposed/stayed prison sentence at the time of the original sentence.  Defendant makes stmt.  Court further addressed the defendant.  Atty Frost makes arguement - opposes this request.  Rebuttal by Mr. Conner.
COURT:  motion is denied - has the right to appeal today's decision
Defendant makes further stmt
Court further addressed the defendant
Court of appeals - postconviction relief is denied

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan C Conner in court with attorney Mary A Swan.  Defendant Bryan C Conner in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 21, 14 CF 28 and 13 CM 249.  9:02 AM Court calls cases and appearances.  Atty Swan Page 6 has correction to the PSI.  Atty Frost tendered a restitution document.  Atty Swan requests 30 days.  Court makes stmt Atty Swan has 30 days to review restitution request.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Swan makes arguement.  Defendant addressed the Court. 

COURT:  advised the defendant there is a no contact with Jessica Beecroft it is in place until the Court states it has been lifted.
        13 CM 249:  90 days county jail with huber for work search/work - costs - 85 days credit 
14 CF 21: 9 months county jail with huber for work search/work - costs - submit a DNA surcharge
  14 CF 20:  impose/stay 4 years prison - 2 years in - 2 yrs ES (count 1) - eligible for challenge and sentence abuse program - probation 3 years pmt of restitution to Tony's Riverside - Economart - Dollar General and Transition Homes $1541.11 (Atty Swan will be allowed a hearing) to be paid at $50.00 per month - costs - comply with any and all treatment that DOC may recommend and follow thru with all recommendations made - psychological assessment/evaluation and any follow thru - obtain and maintain employment - no contact with Jessica Beecroft unless probation and Jessica agree to contact - any condtions DOC may impose - DNA surcharge ordered and sample
   14 CF 28:  impose/stay 4 years prison - (ct 1) 2 yrs in and 2 yrs ES - consecutive to 14 CF 20 eligible for challenge and abuse program
Probation 3 years concurrent to 14 CF 20 - same conditions as in 14 CF 20 - costs - DNA surcharge ordered

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Bryan C Conner appeared with Attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  Attorney Thomas Frost appeared for the State.  Also has 14 CF 20, 14 CF 21, 13 CF 110 and 13 CM 249. Brendan Harrington is officer in 14 CF 20.  Court will recuse in 14 CF 20 as officer is the court's 1st cousin.  State addressed the Court requests $1000.00 cash.  Atty Swan addressed the Court. Court bail will continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.
